p: Although the plant has not been previously tested against P. gingivalis, the compound juglone, known to be in J. regia [ 73], has activity against P. gingivalis, with an MIC of 39 μg/mL [ 74]. However, the similarity of this juglone MIC to the J. regia crude extract MICs determined in our study (32 to 64 μg/mL) suggests that the anti- P. gingivalis activity of these complex extracts is not solely due to juglone. No robust studies have specifically investigated J. regia against oral bacteria with methods following CLSI guidelines [ 75].
